goto.title: Goto
goto.description: Jump to a specific line in your code.
goto.det_desc: Goto is used to jump to a specific line during runtime. With goto, loops can easily be implemented as seen in the following examples.

examples.title: Infinite loop
examples.description: This loop will infinitely increase i by one (until an overflow-error occurs)

examples.title: Finite loop
examples.code:
i = 0
if i < 10 goto 3 end goto 4
i++ goto 2
examples.description: For each iteration this loop compares if i is smaller than 10 and increases i by one if this is the case.

if.title: If
if.description: Execute a block of code if expression is fulfilled.
if.det_desc: An if clause is used to create more complex programs by introducing conditions. If a certain thing is given, then the program should do something - otherwise it shouldn't.

examples.title: Finite loop
examples.code:
i = 0
if i < 10 goto 3 end goto 4
i++ goto 2
examples.description: For each iteration this loop compares if i is smaller than 10 and increases i by one if this is the case - i won't be increased above 10.

if else.title: If else
if else.description: Execute a block of code if expression is fulfilled, otherwise execute something else.
if else.det_desc: Adding to the standard if clause, the 'else' keyword adds another layer of customization to conditions.

examples.code:
thirsty = "true"
if thirsty == "true" then milk = "existent" else milk = "gone" end
examples.description: If thirsty is set to true, then set another field called milk to existent, otherwise to gone.
